Description: Greenstone facies cylinder seal, contest scene - two antithetical groups; bearded hero (Gilgamesh?), wearing a skirt, in conflict with a bull which is looking back over its shoulder. Lion in conflict with a bull-man who is looking back over his shoulder. Terminal; inscription in a frame.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1982a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals II: Akkadian, Post Akkadian, Ur III Periods (73, pl.X)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge (?)
